talk.title: 10 Tips For Work
talk.description: Aviel will discuss his top 10 tips for your first job.

talk.title: Communication Mistakes
talk.description: Helen will talk about communication mistakes.

talk.title: Hacking for Humanity
talk.description: Keryn will talk about what she learned at her first weekend 'hackathon', working with a team for a social enterprise called Right Click Community.

talk.title: Having an Open Mind
talk.description: Kylie will discuss the importance of being open to different ideas.

talk.title: Ravi's 50 Shades of Blue
talk.description: The blue man speaks out about life as a monochrome lover!

talk.title: This Is The End?
talk.description: You won't want to miss this talk!

talk.title: The Invisible Man
talk.description: Where is Ashton? Learn from the disappearing master himself!

talk.title: From Waterfall to Agile
talk.description: Spending 50% of your time on planning and designing or getting progress for every sprint? That's your choice!

talk.title: Code a 'Jumpy Piranha' Game in 10 Minutes
talk.description: Greg is a newbie himself, and he will demo how to code a game like Flappy Bird, the game that earned the creator around $50,000 per day. The demo will be a few minutes, but enough to get you rolling like a cannon ball. REQUIREMENTS: A laptop, wifi. A webserver installed on the laptop. Rails will do, might be an overkill though. A few grey cells, fingers and 2 sockets with eyeballs in 'em.

talk.title: You Can't Animate This!
talk.description: Ivan will discuss a variety of CSS animations and their application in user experience design.

talk.title: The Prisoner's Dilemma
talk.description: Toby will talk about the prisoner's dilemma, its intellectual consequences in Economics and real world applications in negotiation.
